p: SEDDSs are the preferred formulation for incorporation into capsules or tablets for oral ingestion. There is also interest in transforming liquid SEDDSs into solid forms. Thus, previous research fabricated vitamin A SEDDSs, consisting of soybean oil, Cremophor EL, and Capmul MCM-C8, and mixed them with microcrystalline cellulose (Avicel Â®) to generate solid powders that can be compressed into tablets [ 74]. The researchers then orally administered these tablets (vitamin A dose: 7.5 mg/kg) to rats for pharmacokinetic examination. The average peak concentration (C max) was higher for the SEDDS tablets (656 ng/mL) than the conventional tablets (421 ng/mL), indicating improved oral bioavailability.
